title: Britain will face 'very hefty bill' for Brexit, Jean-Claude Juncker tells European Parliament
text:
Britain will face 'very hefty bill' for Brexit, Jean-Claude Juncker tells European Parliament 
EU seeking to recoup money pledged by Britain for future spending Tuesday 21 February 2017 12:14 GMT Click to followIndy Politics 
The UK will be handed a "very hefty bill" for leaving the European Union, Jean-Claude Juncker has warned. 
The President of the European Commission said the EU will seek payment from Theresa May's Government to cover future spending Britain committed to but will not fulfil as a member. 
“The British should know this, they know this already, that it will not be at a discount or at zero cost. The British must respect commitments they were involved in making. So the bill will be, to put it a bit crudely, very hefty," he added. 
Mr Juncker also said Britain would need years to negotiate any future trade deals with the EU after quitting hte bloc. 
“To agree on the future architecture of relations between the United Kingdom and the European Union, we will need years," he told the European Parliament. 
Additional reporting by Reuters
